content: a. The Bishops of the Second Vatican Council described Man as a mystery. In the Pastoral Constitution on the Church in the Modern World, Gaudium et Spes, the bishops wrote that "man, who is the only creature on earth which God willed for itself, cannot fully find himself except through a sincere gift of himself." They recognized the complexity and depth of human nature and emphasized the need for a holistic understanding of the human person that takes into account our spiritual, social, and physical dimensions.
